item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I attempted briefly to consecrate myself in the public library, believing every crack in my soul could be chinked with a book." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Everything you're sure is right can be wrong in another place. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Life is a constant struggle between being an individual and being a member of the community." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Poverty doesn’t give you strength or teach you lessons about perseverance. No, poverty only teaches you how to be poor." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "There are all kinds of addicts, I guess. We all have pain. And we all look for ways to make the pain go away. (107)" -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Humor was an antiseptic that cleaned the deepest of personal wounds." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Joanna Brooks
item.description: "I am not the same kind of Mormon girl I was when I was seven, eight, or eighteen years old. I am not an orthodox Mormon woman like my mother. I am an unorthodox Mormon woman with a fierce and hungry faith. " -- Joanna Brooks

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Joanna Brooks
item.description: "How badly I wanted to belong as I had when I was a young Mormon girl, to be simply a working part in the great Mormon plan of salvation, a smiling exemplar of our sparkling difference. But instead I found myself a headstrong Mormon woman staking out her spiritual survival at a difficult point in Mormon history. " -- Joanna Brooks

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Joanna Brooks
item.description: "Religion is about responsibility to a community and a tradition ..." -- Joanna Brooks

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction is one of the few experiences where loneliness can be both confronted and relieved. Drugs, movies where stuff blows up, loud parties -- all these chase away loneliness by making me forget my name's Dave and I live in a one-by-one box of bone no other party can penetrate or know. Fiction, poetry, music, really deep serious sex, and, in various ways, religion -- these are the places (for me) where loneliness is countenanced, stared down, transfigured, treated." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "You will become way less concerned with what other people think of you when you realize how seldom they do." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Acceptance is usually more a matter of fatigue than anything else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Leif Enger
item.description: "Sometimes heroism is nothing more than patience, curiosity, and a refusal to panic." -- Leif Enger

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by R.J. Palacio
item.description: "I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives." -- R.J. Palacio

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by R.J. Palacio
item.description: "Kinder than is <i>necessary</i>. Because it's not enough to be kind. One should be kinder than needed." -- R.J. Palacio

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "We must see all scars as beauty. Okay? This will be our secret. Because take it from me, a scar does not form on the dying. A scar means, 'I survived'." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "Life is savagely unfair. It ignores our deep-seated convictions and places a disproportionate emphasis on the decisions we make in split seconds." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "There are countries of the world, and regions of one's own mind, where it is unwise to travel." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "The church was stuffed with mourners, of course. No one from work - I tried to keep my life and my magazine separate - but otherwise everybody Andrew and I knew was there. It was disorientating, like having the entire contents of one’s address book dressed in black and exported into pews in non alphabetical order." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Amelia Earhart
item.description: "Adventure is worthwhile in itself." -- Amelia Earhart

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Jeanne Ray
item.description: "A slice of cake never made anyone fat. You don't eat the whole cake. You don't eat a cake every day of your life. You take the cake when it is offered because the cake is delicious. You have a slice of cake and what it reminds you of is someplace that's safe, uncomplicated, without stress. A cake is a party, a birthday, a wedding. A cake is what is served on the happiest days of your life." -- Jeanne Ray

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Jeanne Ray
item.description: "Cakes have gotten a bad rap. People equate virtue with turning down dessert. There is always a person at the table...No, really, I couldn't...Everyone who is pressing a fork into that first tender layer looks at the person who declined the plate, and they all think, That person is better than I am. That person has discipline. But that isn't a person with discipline, that is a person who has completely lost touch with joy." -- Jeanne Ray

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Ayad Akhtar
item.description: "Always imagine him close to you when you pray,' she explained. 'If you think of Him as near, then that's where you will find Him. And if you think of Him as far away, then that's where He will be." -- Ayad Akhtar

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "The essence of the independent mind lies not in what it thinks, but in how it thinks." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "In the end, fiction is the craft of telling truth through lies." -- Lauren Groff

item.title: Cate Brooks add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "Childhood is such a delicate tissue; what they had done this morning could snag somewhere in the little ones, make a dull, small pain that will circle back again and again, and hurt them in small ways for the rest of their lives." -- Lauren Groff
